docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to the Jewish Music Wiki. For now the only page is a short but growing list of Jewish songs inspired by other songs.

I'd like to expand it other resources, such as lists of different melodies of different zemiros and tefilos, and song lists for different times of the year or life cycle events.

Please feel free to contribute by clicking the edit button in the top right corner of the page (below the search bar)!

-Eli

docs.title: Chanukah
docs.text: • Maoz Tzur -- Nun Freut Euch, Liebe Christen, G'mein

docs.title: Purim
docs.text:
• Chayav Inish Livsumei seems to be borrowed from this Hungarian tune
  • Mishenichnas Adar -- Pick A Bale of Cotton

docs.title: Various Modern Music
docs.text: • Yehuda!'s Umacha -- Chris de Burgh's Snows of New York

docs.title: Country Yossi
docs.text:
• A Boy Named Zlateh -- A Boy Named Sue
  • Big Bad Moish -- Big Bad John
  • Shacharis in the Morning -- Sugartime by The McGuire Sisters

docs.title: Uncle Moishy
docs.text: • Torah Torah Torah -- Let Us Sing Together

docs.title: Israeli
docs.text:
• Hatikvah -- La Mantovana by Giuseppe Cenci ca. 1600
  • See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatikvah#Melody_and_its_origins
  • Jerusalem of Gold -- Pello Joxepe, a Basque lullaby
  • See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem_of_Gold#History
